data.text: The folly of a man spoils his ways:
Wealth acquires many friends;
A false witness shall not be unpunished,
Many court the favor of kings;
Every one who hates his poor brother
He that procures wisdom loves himself;
A false witness shall not be unpunished;
Delight does not suit a fool,
A merciful man is long-suffering;
The threatening of a king is like the roaring of a lion;
A foolish son is a disgrace to his father:
Fathers divide house and substance to their children:
Cowardice possesses the effeminate man;
He that keeps the commandment keeps his own soul;
He that has pity on the poor lends to the Lord;
Chasten thy son, for so he shall be hopeful;
A malicious man shall be severely punished,
Hear, son, the instruction of thy father,
There are many thoughts in a manâ€™s heart;
Mercy is a fruit to a man:
The fear of the Lord is life to a man:
He that unjustly hides his hands in his bosom,
When a pestilent character is scourged, a simple man is made wiser:
He that dishonors his father, and drives away his mother,
A son who ceases to attend to the instruction of a father
He that becomes surety for a foolish child will despise the ordinance:
Scourges are preparing for the intemperate,
